div.bibl: The Reform Advocate, Vol. 53, Wk. of June 2, 1917. p. 608.

body.p: Henry Dubin has won the Francis W. Plym Fellowship in Architecture, from the University of Illinois. This includes $1,000 to study in Europe, but on account of the war, Mr. Dubin will devote himself to work for the United States Government in the architectural department of the Navy.
The Fellowship was won by Mr. Dubin from a large field of contestants representing the entire country.
